week12.io

Class AtmServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • week12.io.AtmServer

  • public class AtmServer
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the server implementation. It listens for a client request, the creates a new ClientConn to setup an async connection and then returns to listen for the next connection attempt.
    Author:
    scottl

      • start

        public void start()

      • initializeServer

        private void initializeServer()
        Initialize the server. If server can't be initialized (socket error) then the app exits.

      • startListening

        private void startListening()
        This supports multiple clients connecting to it. The server method accept() blocks until a client requests a connection. At that point the method returns and assigns a Socket instance to the client variable. This client instance is then wrapped in the ClientConn object which handles the communications between client and the server. A thread is used to handle this communication The listener goes back and listens for another client.

      • log

        private void log(java.lang.String msg)
